author: terence0083
content:
I'm not sure why these must be processed during the consensus phase if they are included in the header. In ePBS, consensus and execution are pipelined. This means there will be a post-consensus state root and a post-execution state root. So what does it mean if they are in the header?

- The CL client already caches the header in the beacon state. The ePBS beacon state has a modified field `execution_payload_header`.
- Once the builder reveals the `execution_payload`, the CL client can process the payload and update the beacon state where the payload was hidden (coudln't be processed at consensus phase). The CL client needs to verify `htr(payload.object) == header.root`.
- For such objects, consensus processing is deferred until the execution phase.
- Having the objects in the header is better than in the block body because builders don't need to gossip these objects over bid.
